titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4837) making appropriations for military construction, family housing, and base realignment and closure for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-621, by Mrs. Myrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4837 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by paragraph. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 210.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 732.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on adoption of the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Frost demanded the Yeas and Nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the previous question and a possible subsequent roll call vote on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 197 (Roll no. 400).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 211 (Roll no. 401).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/21/2004--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4837) making appropriations for military construction, family housing, and base realignment and closure for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005.
